Хорошие, решабельные головоломки. Начало игры мне показалось довольно банальным, но после первой главы сюжет стал значительно интереснее. Немного смутило ощущение, что в самом начале графика местами выглядела хуже, чем в 1 игре, но в дальнейшем качество графики выровнялось. В игре приятный, ненавязчивый саундтрек. Имеется возможность подсветки активных предметов, что экономит время прохождения. Кроме того, почти все ненужные для действий предметы престают подсвечиваться, позволяя сосредоточиться на необходимых деталях головоломок. Небольшой минус: большинство локаций шире экрана, поэтому персонажа приходится перемещать по всей локации, чтобы увидеть все активные предметы. Если не дойти до какого-то края локации, можно не заметить нужный предмет.

В игре также есть несколько необязательных дополнительных квестов, а одно задание можно выполнить двумя разными способами. Здесь есть несколько заданий, на которые требуется ограниченное время, но на них дается неограниченное число попыток, и времени вполне достаточно, чтобы разобраться в необходимых действиях.

If you loved the first part (and the Critter chronicles) you won't be disappointed by the sequel. BoUT2 comes with a great sense of humor, boosted by a remarkable voice acting which is most of the time just brilliant. While the graphics have their ups and downs, the animations are very accurate and always nice to look at. However, like in the first part, the permanent stream of dull, generic orchestral background music made me turn it off at some early stage. So in the end, only one issue really overshadowed the whole experience: The game is way (!) too heavy on the dialog side. Be prepared to endure (or skip) endless weary blathering before you are finally allowed to put the next step into action. I finished the game within approx 47 hours - mostly because of listening, not of gaming....

Sometimes less is more. This issue is the main reason why I would give the game "just" a 7.5 out of 10.

36371395.review:
[h1]Short version: 92%[/h1]
Better visuals and music, a more grandiose story, and the same old cast make sure that The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 is not only a worthy successor of the beloved point ‘n’ click adventure game, but even manages to surpass it.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 brings us back to the magical land of Avantasia to meet our stalwart heroes one more time, who may have gone their separate ways since the events of the first game, but a new sinister plot quickly drags them back to adventuring.

As expected from a sequel, everything is now a little bigger and even a little better; this goes especially for the breath-taking graphics and the soundtrack. Only one thing got smaller, the time we spend with former protagonists Ivo, Nate, and Creature, as they now serve a secondary role to the little gnome mage, Wilbur.

The writing got darker, especially in dialogues and characterisation, and touching a few grim subjects—the humour is still there, but in smaller doses, with only a token amount of geeky in-jokes. The puzzles reflect this nature, as they are closer to traditional adventure game mechanics, where we can catch some of the genre-defining moon logic, but for the most part, they are only there to serve as some form of gameplay between plot elements.

Said plot is incredibly intricate, to the point where it could even stand as the story of a complex RPG. It has one crucial flaw though: it leaves quite a few threads hanging, and ends in a gigantic cliffhanger. Considering we have not heard of a sequel for years, be warned: you can get a wonderful adventure game, but one where you end up with more questions than answers.

36270467.review:
O ile z dobrymi filmami jest tak, że ich kontynuacja zwykle okazuje się gorsza od pierwszej części, tak z grami na szczęscie bywa inaczej. I od tej reguły nie odstaje The Book of Unwritten Tales. Pierwsza część zabierając naś do baśniowego świata była świetną, choć nieskomplikowaną zabawą. Jej druga część jednak kładzie wręcz na łopatki zarówno samą opowiedzianą historią jak i poczuciem humoru i odniesieniami do kultury gier rpg i nie tylko, które w pierwszej części też były, ale kontynuacja wręcz nimi ocieka. Nie trzeba wprawnego oka, żeby dostrzec takie rarytasy jak miecz z minecrafta czy hełm ze Skyrim. Rejestr studentów Akademii Magii wspomina m.in. o uczniu nazwiskiem Yoda Zielonygnom, wspomniana jest gra z użyciem mioteł zaś jawnym ukłonem w stronę Terrego Pratchetta, z którego prozą niewątpliwie kojarzy się uniwersum, w jakim dzieje się cała historia, jest wzmianka o obrazkowych pudełkach i uwaga Wilbura na temat akademickiej biblioteki, w której najlepiej poruszałby się bibliotekarz będący małpą. Świetnie przedstawiono również ewolucję gier RPG, młodsi gracze nawet nie pamietają mrocznych czasów przygodówek bez grafiki, więc ta gra może ich co nieco zdziwić.Takich odniesień jest całe multum – Władca Pierścieni, Blade Runner, fabuły znanych filmów tj. Indiana Jones czy Titanic oraz genialne Autostopem przez Galaktykę. Nie sposób wymienić wszystkiego, ale doszukiwanie się tych smaczków samo w sobie daje niezłą frajdę.
Tym razem nasi bohaterowie znów są osobno. Wilbur jest wykładowcą na Akademii Magii (tak się wybił..), Ivo ze zdumieniem odkrywa, że najwyraźniej jest w ciąży, a Nate – jak to Nate, jest w tarapatach. Trójka naszych bohaterów musi się spotkać i rozwikłać zagadkę tajemniczej plagi cukierkowej różowości, która ogarnia całą Krainę Aventasii i ponownie zmierzyć się z Munkusem.
Pod względem rozgrywki nie zmieniło się wiele, nadal mamy point'n'clicka z niezbyt wymagającymi zagadkami i poruszamy się zamiennie Ivo, Wilburem, Natem i Zwierzakiem (Critterem), choć gra jest nieco bardziej rozbudowana pod względem zadań, jakie stoja przed naszymi bohaterami.
Udoskonalono nieco oprawę graficzną, nie odbiegając przy tym od jej charakteru w pierwszej części. Nadal jest bajecznie kolorowa.
Zakończenie nieco zaskakujące, ale dające nadzieję na kolejną część (bo przeciez nie można tak zakańczać dobrej historii!). Mam nadzieję, że kiedyś się ukaże.

36107540.review: Like a really good book, it kind of starts slowly and you have to stick with it a bit but it turns into a really engrossing experience, with some amazing bits of gameplay and imagination. The puzzles are at a really good level, I think - the few times I cheated and checked a walkthrough, I could see exactly how the game was trying to give me hints and I somehow thought in a completely different direction. The only criticism I have is that I broke the game at one point and a vital item just completely disappeared, and after checking a walkthrough after walking around stumped for about an hour I had to load from a previous save and play the whole section again, which wasn't much fun - to be fair, though, I looked online and noone else had the same problem so I think I did something truly weird. You probably won't do that, so. Fine.

34848834.review:
Мне очень понравилась первая игра. Вторая еще красочнее, обширнее и продолжительнее. Здесь много эпизодов с Вилбуром, которого я обожаю. Актеры озвучки те же. Участвуют многие знакомые персонажи.
Два "но". Во-первых, оригинальную игру я прошла, практически не заглядывая в прохождение. И это было здорово. Понятные задачи, логичные решения. По поводу любой проблемы можно было переговорить с действующими лицами эпизода и услышать конкретные наводки. Новая игра же задачи делает абстрактными, а окружающие чаще только разводят руками. Пойди туда, не знаю куда, и сделай то, не знаю что. Каким образом можно догадаться собрать нечто полезное из [spoiler]колеса для хомячка, меха, скотча, надутой резины и открытого крана[/spoiler], кроме перебора всех вещей инвентаря одна на другой, "авось подействует"? 
Во-вторых, это политическая сатира. Тут вам и беженцы, и ксенофобия, и шпилька в адрес радикальных борцов за социальную справедливость. Конфликт строится вокруг противоборства двух "партий", одна из которых придерживается либерально-демократической риторики, ее возглавляет благородный волшебник, в ней состоят положительные персонажи. Другую, консервативно настроенную, возглавляет вредоносный делец, а сторонники ее изображены тупыми, злобными, подлыми ([spoiler]вторая голова огра, торговец, тролль[/spoiler]). Игра нет-нет да сообщает вам нравоучение на тему. Напоминает "Незнайку на Луне". 
Меня это не останавливает, но делает прохождение гораздо более утомительным и раздражающим, чем оно могло бы быть.

34693817.review: Good game! I don't like the ending but overall I'm very pleased with this title. Has more content that the first game. During my playthrough I stumbled upon some very visible (maybe 'apparent' is a better word here) bugs/gliches but nothing game breaking so it's ok.

34684705.review:
Eine wunderschöne Fortsetzung des ersten Teils!

The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 knüpft direkt an die Geschehnisse des ersten Teils an. Die Stärken des Vorspiels wurden ausgebaut. Tolle Eastereggs und zahlreiche Anspielungen parodisierender Art auf andere Fantasy-Größen wie Herr der Ringe, Game of Thrones und viele mehr sind vorhanden und bringen des Öfteren kleinere Schmunzelmomente. Das Genre eines Point'N'Click Adventures ist nicht so populär, das mag durchaus sein, aber gerade bei diesem Spiel sollte man den Entwicklern eine Chance geben. Das über Kickstarter finanzierte Spiel ist seinen Preis mehr als wert und weiß wunderbar zu unterhalten.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist mittelhoch bis hoch einzuordnen, denn die Rätsel sind teils zwar einfach, aber manche Gegenstandskombinationen sind doch extrem seltsam - um nicht zu sagen: Total bescheuert. Doch gerade hier liegt der Spaß, denn auch bei fehlerhaften Kombinationen sind die Hauptcharaktere mit lustigen und flotten Sprüchen dabei und kommentieren das Ganze auf eine unnachahmliche Art. 

Das Spiel baut ziemlich auf den Erlebnissen von Teil 1 auf; es ist zwar an sich auch ohne Vorwissen spielbar, aber viele Andeutungen entgehen einem dann bzw. der tiefere Sinn geht verloren. Für alle Kenner von The Book of Unwritten Tales kann ich die Fortsetzung aber ABSOLUT empfehlen!

34555606.review:
老實說
缺點有點多
整體的話 我給大概7/10吧
-
第一大缺點 空白鍵按出來的提示只持續一小段時間
雖然可以一直按一直按 但很煩阿
一代我拿個東西把空白鍵壓住就可以單手玩了

結局不是皆大歡喜
雖然該打敗的壞人是打敗了沒錯
但我方損失慘重 令人難過
這種走迪士尼歡樂路線的遊戲
給個全員生還 皆大歡喜的結局不好嗎?
老套歸老套 但我相信很多人就是想看這種老套阿
第三缺點
會卡住
我有發現有時候你去跟NPC講話時他不會馬上回你
他會等當下的動作做完 才會回答
我想大概是這個部分沒有做好 導致有時會在這種地方卡住
雖然不是卡死 可以叫出選單 讀檔就好 但還是很煩
第四缺點
那個物品欄太多此一舉了
而 且 很 擋 視 線
一代直接排列在畫面下方 現在持有什麼一目瞭然
二代是收在右下角的背包裡
雖然可以保持開啟或關閉
但關閉很麻煩 這種遊戲不就是隨時要拿物品出來跟物件互動嗎
保持開啟又很擋路
遇到好幾次
開背包>點選物品>關背包>點選地圖物件
的情形

第五缺點
沒有章節選擇 即使已經全破了
一代也沒有 但一代沒成就阿
很多成就都是限定進度的
比如說解某個謎的時候一次過
或是某個類似小遊戲的東西全中
我是懶得從頭解了 我放棄
第六缺點
應該比較少人會遇到
這種老遊戲 沒有無邊框視窗化的選項 我不驚訝
選視窗化 用Borderless Gaming把它強制無邊框視窗就好
但是問題出在 我用兩個螢幕
每次開遊戲 它就會變成橫跨兩個螢幕的神奇大小
雖然也是走個設定點幾下就解決的事情
但就是煩
-
優點的部分
與其說是二代的優點 不如說維持了這系列該有的水準
該幽默的地方還是有幽默
物件部分像是MINECRAFT的劍 FFVII克勞德的大劍 上古卷軸有名的那頂頭盔

很多一代的腳色繼續出場

而且也不是說沒玩過一代就沒辦法玩二代

Веоликолепный квест. Как и первая часть. Очень рекомендую всем, особенно увлекающимся фантастикой и фентези.
Плюсы:
-Как то ни удивительно, игра грузится просто МОМЕНТАЛЬНО, даже на мем шестилетнем компе. Особенно это удивляет на фоне гораздо более плоско-нарисованных творений Daedalic
-Красивая картинка. Редко когда обращал на это внимание в квестах, но эльфийский замок очарователен.
-Самое главное - атмосфера, а именно диалоги и фишечки в оформлении, которые заставляют вспомнить отличные игры и фильмы, получить удовольствие и посмеяться. Пратчетт, Монти Пайтон, Звездные Войны, Гарри Поттер и многое другое - великолепные и остроумные отсылки к массе винрарных вещей.
- Квест несложный в том смысле что нет пиксельхантинга, загадки очень дружелюбны и ни разу не пришлось искать в инете ответ. В результате это скорее классная история, с отвлечениями на темы из отличных книг и фильмов, нежели классический квест с пиксельхантингом и ломанием головы над неочевидным применением предметов. Герои сами говорят, чего им не хватает в текущей ситуации.

Минусы.
Нашел пару багов, но ни один из них не сломал игру. Пришлось перезагрузить ее, но благодаря системе автосейва с "продолжить", никакого прогресса не потерял.

32145873.review:
Fair warning: if you haven't played BOUT1, I don't recommend starting with the sequel. You will probably be more than a little confused with the story. Critter Chronicles can be skipped if you want, though I still plan to play it, if for no other reason than I need a third game in this wonderful franchise ASAP.

While the narrative is very connected between games 1 and 2, this one takes things up several notches. You can see it immediately in the production value, particularly in terms of the beautiful visuals. In just about every way, the look and feel of the game has stepped up in effort and budget by a substantial and noticable amount. The first game feels instantly dated once you play this sequel. 

Gameplay-wise, the games are pretty identical. The puzzles are some of the best the genre has to offer, often based on the interaction of multiple playable characters which you swap between freely. There is very little, if any moon logic. But there's just enough challenge to make it cerebral enough for puzzle addicts like me.

Then there's the story. While the first game was a fourth-wall breaking comedy, the sequel is a 'dramedy'; serious and soulful AND filled with laughs. Coming from being a fan of darker stories like Gabriel Knight, I appreciate a story that makes me care this much without resorting to melodrama.

This is a classic in the adventure game genre, and I cannot recommend it enough. If you ever want proof that these games haven't completely died, here it is.

Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.
Plus de détails en bas.

---

La digne suite du premier épisode. Le système de jeu est le même, les points positifs sont identiques : possibilité d'afficher les interactions possible à l'écran, qui disparaissent quand aucun dialogue n'est plus disponible, quatre personnages jouables, et la plupart du temps deux en parralèle, et enfin de nombreuses références humoristiques à d'autres univers et jeux vidéos.

Le doublage (non, pas de français) est excellent, à part un ou deux personnages agaçant (le maire de la ville du dernier chapitre, par exemple), les graphismes sont magnifiques pour un jeu du genre, et la durée de vie est exceptionnelle. Plus de 20h pour terminer un point&click - sans galérer outre mesure - c'est vraiment rare ! La difficulté est bien dosée, et aucune énigme n'est incohérente.

Bref, du bon, mangez-en.

---

La version Linux est excellente. Aucun soucis rencontré.

OS: Linux Mint 18.1 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

Inizia una nuova avventura per gli eroi che hanno salvato Aventasia, Il piccolo Wilbur diventato finalmente mago e professore, la principessa elfica del regno dei boschi Ivo ed il capitano Nate con il suo fidato amico rosa Critter e la sua nave Mary. Il gruppo questa volta si ritroverà a fare i conti con il ritorno di Munkus e le sue macchinazioni per ottenere la bacchetta magica di Wilbur e il libro dei morti per entrare così in possesso di straordinari poteri. Nell'avventura per fortuna verranno aiutati da vecchi e nuovi amici incontrati durante il loro cammino.
Il gioco come in precedenza si svolge in cinque capitoli che ci metteranno di fronte a nuovi compiti ed enigmi da risolvere per poter proseguire la nostra avventura, ci troveremo ad utilizzare uno solo dei nostri eroi o in coppia, dividendo sempre i compiti e cercando, parlando e combinando gli oggetti sparsi lungo la nostra avventura.
Il gioco è molto divertente in linea con il precedente da cui eredita e aumenta i momenti esilaranti e le battute tra i vari personaggi e i maggiori riferimenti ai film, migliorata la grafica e soprattutto sono sparite le bande nere ai lati. Ottime ancora una volta le musiche e la caratterizzazione dei personaggi sviluppati in modo davvero perfetto, non mancheranno inoltre durante il gioco alcuni colpi di scena.
Il finale aperto apre le porte ad un terzo episodio che spero che mantenga lo spirito dei due già usciti.

29656117.review:
I remember the Book of Unwritten Tales as the funniest and greatest point & click I have ever played ; that is why the announcement of a sequel made me so enthusiastic and impatient. The first game was splendid but the Critter Chronicles a bit less enjoyable, so I was afraid of being disappointed. But I wasn't. At all. This game is pure gold ! 

Wilbur, Nate, Critter and Ivo (and others) - those memorable characters you learned to love in the previous games - are back once again to save Aventásia. This adventure offers around 20 hours of entertaining gameplay : probably the lengthiest point & click that I know of. Gladly the kind humour remains the same, with so many references of Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones, etc. This game made me smile and laugh so many times I stopped counting. The gameplay is intuitive, but there are complex and challenging puzzles or actions nevertheless.

From an artistic point of view, the game is simply astonishing : the graphics are gorgeous and colorful, sometimes you just take a minute to admire the background and the details ; the soundtrack regroups elements of the first game and adds some new splendid musics (surprised myself humming after playing) ; the voice acting remains impeccable, at least in English.

I would advise to play [url=store.steampowered.com/app/215160/]The Book of Unwritten Tales[/url] first in order to get familiar with the story and the characters. In my humble opinion this game deserves more credit : it's a must-have for comedy / point and click lovers. Let me cross my fingers for a Book of Unwritten Tales 3.

29273164.review:
Nice, but not as good as its predecessor(s)!

The First BoUT took me by surprise and I ended up simply loving it. It had clever humor, nice references and fantastic characters. The "extension" named Critter's Chronicles didn't quite live up to the first game, but was still quite fun and still had that quirky humor that I loved in the first one. When it comes to this installment I'm slightly disappointed. Don't get me wrong. I still think it is quite good and well worth playing if you are into adventure games, but to me it falls a bit flat and thin compared to the others.

Firstly, it has to be said that this game is probably one of the lengthiest point & click adventure games I've ever played, and that should be a good thing. Only, I feel like the story and plot has been stretched just for that reason, to be lengthy. This makes portions of the game feel a bit dull and unnecessary, and I hate to say it, but it could have gained a lot by shortening it a bit to keep momentum up. This caused me to get a bit bored with it all and I had to take some breaks from the game to do something else and then come back to it. Something that is unusual for me to do.

You get to play the same characters as you do in the previous titles and they are all very familiar, though I found it to lack a bit of the fun banter they had in the first game. For the most part the voice actors on both the main characters and the NPC's you meet on the way are done well, but is at times a bit monotone. Wilbur especially seem to react pretty much the same way to every situation. At times it feels a bit more read out loud voicing instead of acting while voicing. I'm however more surprised about the voicing of some of the NPC's as some of them are really good. I also like that you get to meet a lot of the characters you met through your first adventure in this universe, and more than a handful of new ones as well. Sadly my favorite from the first game was nowhere to be found here (Death).

When the game finally came to an end it felt very anticlimactic to me. A bit rushed even, which seems odd seeing that everything else seemed stretched out. It definitely leaves you on a cliffhanger with hints to a 3rd book coming eventually. And, even though I felt this was a step down from the first, I hope there will be another one. There is a lot of talent in this team and I want to see where they take it next.

Artistically the game is brilliant. It looks absolutely stunning. The scenery and backdrops are highly detailed and has a lot of fun elements to them. The characters and their animations are well designed and suitably quirky in the way they behave. You're bound to fall in love with several of them.

The music is also very well made, and clearly inspired by the works of John Williams. Already in the main menu did I feel like I was going to go on an Indiana Jones adventure. I would however have liked a bit more sound effects in the game itself. Some ambient sounds and the like to build up the atmosphere of your surroundings, and also maybe some more dramatic build-ups to certain events. However, I do understand that one does have to cut some corners to make budget.

There are some technical issues too. I did not experience any crashing or game-breaking bugs, but I had quite a few losses of audio. More a slight irritation than anyhing as you also get text to read, so you don't necessarily lose much. It also seemed a bit unresponsive at times  and I had several occations where I had to click several times on an item for my character to interact with it and even to walk to certain places. I also found the inventory a bit clunky to deal with, but that could possibly just be preferences.

All in all it is mostly a good game but it failed to really engage me. After completing it I felt a bit unfulfilled, and I was left with several unanswered questions. Let's hope that they continue the story and ties up all the loose ends there and go out with a big bang. For an adventure fan there is still a lot of worth in this title and I would certainly not want to miss it, but it does not feel like a game that would make many new fans of the genre either. By this time the game should be pretty easy to get on a sale, so if you are looking for a lengthy and cheap adventure you might want to look into it. It would certainly be worth getting on a discounted price.

I'm ending up giving this a 6/10 rating which might be a bit strict. At least compared to the overall ratings here at Steam. But to me it is slightly above average. It is of course a subjective opinion and if you read this as a tool to decide to get the game or not, be sure to check out several reviews and not base it on this alone. Even though I didn't find it to be all that good, your opinion could differ a lot from mine. And clearly a lot of others found this to be very very good. Thanks for taking the time to read my review :o)

Happy gaming!

TJ

I played numerous point-and-click adventure games in my life and this is one of the best point-and-click adventure games I have played in years.  The game offers great funny dialogues, likable characters, amazing graphics (especially for a point-and-click game) and an entertaining storyline.  I didn't play any of the previous games in the series but I had no problem following the game, since I was able to draw out plenty of information from the dialogues between the characters.  For the price, the length of the game is perfect (about 20-30 hours, depending on how patient you are to go through each and every dialogue) and thanks to the feature that lets you know what you can and cannot interact with (space bar, and it's going to show what's available around you), you don't need outside help that much.  All of the puzzles/missions/quests in the game are very intuitive and fun, arguably a little too formulaic and not that creative, but still enjoyable.

Now I'm very much intrigued to try the other games in the series.  The game is worth every penny at its full price and at its sale price it's definitely a steal.  Hope everyone picks it up during this holiday season and dive into the adventure of Nate, Willard, Ivo and Critter.   Very highly recommended.

J'aime les jeux pointer-cliquer, de Myst à Sybéria en passant par l'antique Monkey Island. Tous m'ont ravi. The Book Of Unwritten Tales 2 ne fait pas exeption: des personnages savoureux évoluent dans de splendides décors. L'inventaire n'est jamais trop plein et les énigmes juste assez difficiles pour exciter notre curiosité. les voix (anglais sous-titré en français) sont particulièrement réussies, on voit que les comédiens ont eu du plaisir. Parfois, bien sûr, il faut tricher (visionner un gameplay déjà fait) car le déplacement d'un décor à l'autre peut devenir désespérant mais rappelez-vous de deux choses: il faut pointer partout, un détail peut facilement vous échapper et, surtout, n'hésitez pas à toujours retourner questionner les personnages: la découverte d'un seul objet parfoit débloque toute une nouvelle série de dialogues.

Bref, je recommande fortement ce jeu. Vous en aurez pour une bonne cinquantaine d'heures (bien sûr, je ne suis pas un génie alors ça peut vous prendre moins) mais peu importe le nombre d'heures, vous en aurez un grand plaisir.

26677913.review:
[h1]The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 [/h1]
Suite de The Book of Unwritten Tales premier du nom, cet épisode se déroule quelques années plus tard et nous permet de retrouver nos 4 héros, Wilbur, Ivo, Nate et Critter. On découvre rapidement que pas mal de choses se sont passées pour chacun d’entre eux ainsi que pour la politique d’Aventasia. Un mal rode à nouveau et nos héros vont se retrouver projeter de gré ou de force dans une nouvelle aventure pour notre plus grand plaisir. 
Ce qui frappe en premier c’est le majestueux bon en avant au niveau des graphismes. Ils étaient déjà beaux dans le premier opus, ils sont vraiment magnifiques dans celui là. La musique est toujours aussi agréable et colle parfaitement avec l’univers du jeu. 
L’un des gros points forts de la série c’est aussi son humour et ses clins d’œil cinématographiques ainsi qu’à l’univers des jeux vidéos. Ici on peut dire que les auteurs ne manquent pas d’imagination, c’est parfaitement réussi, c’est bourré de références et d’humour. [spoiler]La référence aux vieux jeux via l’énigme du voyage dans le temps est juste géniale !! [/spoiler] 
J’ai trouvé l’histoire aussi captivante que dans le premier, c’est d’ailleurs renforcé par le fait de retrouver de très nombreux personnages secondaires qui vont jouer des rôles plus ou moins important dans l’histoire et auxquels on arrive à s’attacher presque autant que nos 4 héros. 
Les énigmes demandent un petit peu plus de réflexion que dans le 1 et on reste parfois bloqué parce qu’on ne pense pas à la bonne association d’objet mais l’ensemble reste néanmoins assez facile. 
Il m’a fallu plus de 30h pour compléter l’histoire, on peu facilement le finir plus vite si on utilise la solution ou qu’on reste jamais bloqué mais la durée de vie reste très bonne pour un jeu de ce type. 
Après cette liste élogieuse, je suis malheureusement obligé de parler du seul point négatif de ce jeu : sa fin ! Frustrante, bâclée sont les mots qui me viennent en tête, on a un goût de trop peu et seul une suite pourra la rendre digeste. 

[h1]En conclusion :[/h1] 
Malgré une fin un peu difficile à digérer, « The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 » nous permet de retrouver de nombreux personnages tous plus attachants les uns que les autres et nous replonge dans une aventure riche et bourrée d’humour. Je ne peux que recommander vivement ce jeu en espérant qu’une suite viendra effacer le seul point négatif que je lui ai trouvé.

[b]Bilan : 9/10[/b]

[h1]English summary :[/h1] 
Despite a ending difficult to come to terms with, "The Book of Unwritten Tales 2" allow us to see many characters again each more likeable than the last and to plunge us into a rich adventure filled with humor. I highly recommend this game hoping that a sequel will erase the only complaint I have.

26564224.review:
Once again I find myself at the end of a nice story, smiling, wishing for more :-)
After all, that's what I wanted from the very start, given my previous experience with TBOUT1: to laugh a lot. And I did :-) Therefore I can only highly recommend it.


I have no idea how Steam counts the time we spends in a game (you can go AFK for long time in many games) but apparently it took me 10 hours more to finish TBOUT2, as compared to TBOUT1.


Pros:
- This time the devs made sure that newbies get a mini-tutorial (as opposed to TBOUT1)
Yeah, I know it's not that much of a problem for a point and click adventure game, but still, it's more like a matter of "to be or not to be ... professional"
- I was able to play the game in Windowed Mode. Yay, go devs !
- I played it on Linux ! Should I say more ? Once again, many thanks to the devs ! And Steam, of course :-)


Cons (Not really):
a.) I know that the devs had some "special reasons" not to explain in detail how Ivo got ... hmm ... (no spoiler here, they know very well what I'm talking about) but almost the entire begining of the game revolves around the idea that she is simply "totally unaware". Somehow she even makes this a personal quest, to find out "how and when". And yet, even if she's so "amazed", she blames Nate for dumping her... Really ?!
The game tries to ... sort of ... explain ... something ... but it still ends up with a dilema: is Ivo the victim of Nate ? If she was, let's say... drunk .. then it does not explain the "happy ending of the game" ... In fact this whole story should have ended with a huge scandal ... and an opportunity for Mr. Shieldhand to finally act as a representative of the law :-)
Or did she knew exactly "what, how and when it all happened", from the very start, but decided to just play the innocent in front of us all, including her mother ? In this case, just as in real life, many got fooled by a woman's acting talent ... and I can only pitty Nate ... :-) Well, one can easily pitty Nate for having such a lame mother-in-law too but ... :-)

b.) Several quests were a bit clumsy in many aspects, either not very intuitive or lacking a clear logical path. We are talking about a fantasy game but the usage of some items (in their specific scenarios) proved to be ... arguable. Not good.


(Weird) Issues:
This may turn out to be a Linux sound system problem because I somehow remember having the same weird behavior on one of the Borderlands games. Still ...
Several times, when I started the game, the sound was "scrambled". I could only "fix" the problem by changing the current sound output to a different output and then switch back.
(Example: Current output is speakers. I start the game ... the entire in-game sound is scrambled. Anything else, outside the game, just sounds normal. So I switch from "output: speakers"  to "output: headphones".
I can hear the "good" sound in my headphones. Switch back to output: speakers". Problem fixed.)

26235968.review:
Much like The Book of Unwritten Tales, this sequel is a good choice for people that like comedy point-and-click adventure games. But not so great for those that want a more serious game. The comedy is really great in this one, and personally I feel it is better than the first one. Since the reference humor and fourth-wall-breaking comedy doesn’t get quite as hard-handed as it did at times in the original.

There are a lot of characters from the first game, so if you like them you are most likely going to like them here as well, as their personalities haven’t changed too much.

The only character that seems to have changed a bit is Ivo. I found her role in this game to be particularly funny this time around, especially since I had gotten to know her as an athletic adventure seeking young elf in the first game. And to be honest the only one that truly seemed to belong on a dangerous quest of the four playable characters. To see her being in a gilded cage and wearing a pretty dress was for some reason strangely amusing to me.

There are also plenty of other side characters returning, as well as some new and fun characters thrown into the mix.
As for the puzzles. For the most part they are still great and challenging, however not all of them are equally easy to figure out. There were a few where I had no idea what I was supposed to do, because they just had such an odd solution, that I hardly believed it even after it was done. Like before it is often a good idea to go back and talk to characters you have previously talked to, in order for them to give you the item you need to progress. But it is consistent throughout the game, which is better than being a surprise just once.

The game keeps up the cartoony and charming style, which fits the very comedic and light hearted atmosphere of the game.

A great adventure game and I hope they make a new one. (Even if I hope Critter and Nate won’t be in it. As I dislike those two a lot. But you might like them, and they don’t really affect my view on the game, since they weren’t that terrible. Just preferred if it had been only Ivo and Wilbur.)

By the way, you can play this game without having played its prequels but I strongly recommend clearing [b]The Book of Unwritten Tales[/b] first if you want to get to know characters better.

The Book of Unwritten Tales würde ich wirklich jedem direkt weiterempfehlen, der mich nach einem Point and Click fragt.


Der zweite Teil lässt sich theoretisch auch ohne den ersten gespielt zu haben anfangen. Jedoch geht da dann ein bisschen Story und Background-Wissen flöten bei, was schade wäre.

[b]8/10[/b]

25440122.review:
And the team behind the original game does it again.

Even intro made me smile, the way it makes fun of the intro of the Game of thrones TV series.

Like I said in my previous reviews of the series, it's well written, its funny and contains enough references to other fantasy worlds to make your inner geek wear a great smile on his face.

This time the main focus is on the game's version of a magical wizards university (and yes, there is a magical library involved at some point and there are plenty of nods to Harry Potter and Diskworld as well).

The dialogue and situations are as fun as ever, the puzzles are a less frustrating this time around and it is generally a good time if you like your traditional point an click adventure games.

A lot of the old NPC characters make a welcome return and the nice thing is is that you feel like they have been having some adventures of their own when you run into them again.

It does end on a (partial) cliffhanger though, so I really hope that we can get a BoUT 3.

25269694.review:
Изумительно графически оформленный классический, но без «пиксель хантинга» и с полной озвучкой, фантазийный квест. 

Это вторая или даже третья часть сериала от  KING Art^Games, если учесть приквел. Мой [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198084019881/recommended/215160]обзор к первой части[/url] и [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198084019881/recommended/221830?snr=1_5_9__402]пара слов к приквелу[/url]. Ничего сверхъестественного по сравнению с первой частью не добавлено, но планка качества опять поднята повыше. Вторая часть длиннее чем первая и приквел в сумме. Игра была профинансирована через крудфандинг на kickstarter. Как и остальные части серии история за номером 2 из коробки поддерживала GNU/Linux  и по моим ощущениям сделано это было идеально. Проверено на Ubuntu 14.04, видеокарта Nvidia (GeForce GTX 680). 

Как сильная, так и слабая стороны  «Книги ненаписанных историй» это «пасхалки». Бессмысленно составлять их список в игре, так как она практически состоит из них. Много идей утащено у Терри Пратчетта, взято из Monkey Island, вырвано с корнем у Гарри Поттера, Звёздных войн и Игр Престола. Злобный тролль-уборщик очевидно сбежал из сериала Клиника. Довольно стандартные шутки про ролевиков и женские доспехи. Тут есть юмор, но не сказать что он превалирует на историей и кое где к сожалению скатывается на туалетный (к счастью не сортирный) уровень, тут есть драма [spoiler]Иво беременна не понятно от кого[/spoiler], но она не является определяющей. Главные герои по привычке опять спасают мир. Мир же тому всячески сопротивляется, но как-то без особого огонька. Слишком много тут Вильбура, [spoiler]хотя здесь и у него определённо появляется романтический интерес[/spoiler]. Квест качественный и длинный, но опять кончается весьма неожиданно и много вопросов остаются без ответов. 

Из несколько скомканной концовки становится очевидно, что авторы оставили задел для следующей серии. И в этой серии им лучше решить чем является их приключение, так как настоящая солянка хоть и выглядит весьма аппетитно, но не позволяет считать это произведение шедевром. Несмотря на это я настоятельно рекомендую всем интересующимся квестами эту историю к прочтению, как хорошую и добрую книгу.

[h1]Этот обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры[/url].[/h1]

25074938.review:
Seguito dell'ottimo primo capitolo del 2009 e finanziato con successo tramite campagna kickstarter, The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 è un'avventura punta e clicca di stampo classico, ambientata in un coloratissimo mondo fantasy. Chi ha giocato il primo episodio ritroverà il medesimo ricco cast di eroi, lo gnomo Wilbur, la principessa elfa Ivo, il pirata Nath e la sua spalla pelosa Critter, alle prese ancora una volta con una terribile minaccia da sventare.

La trama non brilla esattamente per originalità, tuttavia il gioco si rivela appassionante e con alcuni colpi di scena, lungo e soddisfacente (sebbene il finale lascia qualche questione in sospeso, si spera per un degno terzo capitolo). La narrazzione, inoltre, è decisamente sopra la media: gli eventi che andremo ad affrontare e i vari dialoghi sono scritti benissimo, all'insegna di un umorismo simpatico e sopra le righe, pieni zeppi di riferimenti alla cultura pop. 

Dal punto di vista del gameplay, ci troviamo di fronte una AG pura, miglialia di oggetti con cui interagire e puzzle da risolvere, senza alcuna contaminazione che caratterizza il genere negli ultimi anni. Gli enigmi sono tutti abbastanza ingegnosi, articolati e ricchi di "pensiero laterale", tipico di questi giochi leggermente fuori di testa. Per fortuna, non si sfocia mai nel ridicolo e basta giusto uno sguardo attento ai vari oggetti e all'ambiente per capire come proseguire. TBoUT2 non è un'avventura particolarmente complicata, non c'è mai la sensazione di una difficoltà forzata o di una voluta perdita di tempo, quindi è adatta tranquillamente anche ai giocatori meno smaliziati.

Il motore grafico dietro questo gioco, pur mostrando limiti dovuti alla sua natura di produzione indipendente, regala ambientazioni che mozzano il fiato per pulizia e utilizzo dei colori, con una realizzazione estetica solida, senza grosse sbavature e dalla grande personalità. Anche i personaggi sono ben caratterizzati, anche se permane una certa legnosità nei movimenti. Molto buono il doppiaggio inglese, le musiche carine ma non brillano e non saranno certo ricordate come memorabili.

Per concludere, questo secondo episodio è una delle migliori avventure degli ultimi anni, longevo, con una sfida adeguata, bello da vedere e soprattutto piacevolissimo da seguire. Per chi si approccia alla saga solo ora, consiglio fortemente di recuperare il primo e la sua espansione, The Critter Chronicle, non tanto per godere al meglio della trama generale, ma soprattutto perchè sono altri due buonissimi giochi.

24838108.review:
Fantástica aventura gráfica (como su primera parte y spin-off) en la que con una trama muy chorra, volveremos a recorrer un mundo de fantasía resolviendo puzzles, que es lo que mola. En esta entrega, dividida en capítulos, controlaremos a cuatro personajes diferentes según el capítulo: una elfa preñada, un retaco gafe, un aventurero subnormal y un bicho que gruñe (y no es una suegra). Algunas veces podremos controlar a varios, pero no a la vez, sino seleccionando uno u otro. La historia me dejó un poco frío. Vamos, que me pareció aburrida, pero por lo menos sirve de excusa para controlar a estos personajillos y toparme con montones de situaciones graciosas.
El humor está muy bien integrado en la trama sin necesidad de chillar todo el rato, como en las series españolas. Los puzzles, muy bien hilados. Me sorprendió cómo de las consecuencias de la resolución un puzzle se las apañan para volver a crear otro puzzle. ¡Permitidme que me coma unas patatas bravas en su honor por ello!
¡Ya he vuelto, sigamos! A nivel gráfico, el juego es exquisito. Podéis ver las capturas detenidamente si no os fiáis. Eso sí, el control es un poco lento. A veces, necesito hacer clic para que el personaje [i]se entere[/i] que tiene que ir a un sitio. Es como zarandear varias veces a alguien dormido gritándole: [i]¡Vengaaa, despierta! ¡Vaaamos![/i]
La música es brutal. Tiene una muy buena banda sonora que pega a la perfección con el tono de cada uno de los capítulos.
El ritmo narrativo es desigual:
[list]
[*]Al principio: ¿En serio esto es la trama del juego? Bueno... Juguemos...
[*]A mitad: El juego mola. Resuelvo puzzles durante horas, pero la trama no avanza.
[*]Final: ¿Qué? ¿Ya ha terminado? ¿Qué demonios ha pasado?
[/list]
Pues eso, mucho rollo y al final, se resuelve todo muy rápido y mal, pero bueno, vas leyendo los diálogos, son graciosetes, hay puzzles...
Ahora llegamos a la paarte chunga: Hay un bug en el juego. Perdí horas y horas y horas y algún minuto más probando mil cosas y nada. Al final, resignado, miré una guía y resulta que lo que había que hacer, ¡no podía hacerlo! Buscando, vi que en los foros de Steam los desarrolladores pusieron enlaces para descargar partidas guardadas en diversos puntos del juego. ¡Por eso te libras, "The Book of Unwritten Tales 2"!
Otro tema que no me gustó fue un puzzle en concreto, de los del tipo minijuego donde tenemos que hacer funcionar una máquina. La lógica, si es que había alguna, me pareció confusa, por no llamarla "incomprensible". Al final, se trata de ir probando cosas al azar y no de pensar. Otro punto negativo para el juego.
A pesar de ser un juego caro, es una aventura divertida, y si los dos puntos negativos que he puesto no te pillan desprevenido, serán sólo un par de detalles menores en un juego que no puede faltar en tu biblioteca.

[b]¿Es necesario tanto personaje?[/b] La verdad es que no. Está bien variar de un capítulo a otro, pero con la consecuencia que algún personaje no ha sido "esencial" en la historia, y lo dicho, que toque, al final, resolverlo todo deprisa y corriendo.
[b]¿Dónde encontraste el bug?[/b] [spoiler]En la zona del desierto, para abrir la pirámide[/spoiler], aunque creo que hay algún bug más con el que no me topé.
[b]Pues sí es algo caro. ¿De verdad vale los 30€ que marca?[/b] Tanto, no. Quizá algún céntimo menos, como 29'99€. Es broma. Espérate a una oferta. Ni loco pagues eso.

24178646.review:
The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 ist, wie sein Vorgänger auch, ein Click and Point-Adventure erster Güte. 
Die Umgebung ist grafisch sehr schön gestaltet und vertraute Orte erscheinen wieder, teils im neuen Gewand, aber dennoch wie man sie kennt. 
Altbekannte Gesichter erwarten uns in diesem Spiel, wie auch neue NPC, die den Handlungsbogen, in 5 Kapiteln, gestalten. Die Charaktersteuerung funktioniert wie beim Vorgänger, eine Interaktion mit dem Charaktären ist auch hier wieder Bestandteil der Aufgabenlösung.
Die Rätsel sind wieder anspruchsvoll und führen durch eine Geschichte mit viel Witz und Humor und natürlich etlichen 
Parodien auf anderweitig bekannte Genres. 

Dass das Spiel auf einen dritten Teil hinauslaufen wird, ist dadurch ersichtlich, dass das Spiel (wie ein gutes Buch)  mit einer Einführung beginnt und sich langsam in Handlung und gefühlter Handlungsgeschwindigkeit steigert. Die Geschichte wird auf einen Höhepunkt zugetrieben, wartet mit unerwarteten Kehrtwenden auf und lässt diese offen, so dass die Freude auf einen Teil 3 berechtigt ist da uns da noch viel erwarten wird. Man darf gespannt sein.

Fazit: Das Spiel ist für Jung und Alt geeignet. Es besticht durch exzellenten Charme und Humor. Einen Pluspunkt in Sachen Lacher haben freilich diejenigen, die in der MMORPG und/oder allgemein Fantasyszene beheimatet sind, da viele parodistische Anspielungen auf bekannte Spiele abzielen. Aber auch wenn dem nicht so ist, so ist eine Menge Spaß garantiert. Wer also Adventures mag der sollte The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 unbedingt einmal spielen. Ich empfehle hierbei aber klar mit The Book of Unwritten Tales 1 zu beginnen, da die Geschichten aufeinander aufbauen.

Yea, I like this game. However, I don't really like repeated blatant ripoffs of other series. The copying of ideas from Harry Potter like the Fireplace Network (Floo Network), Broomball (Quidditch) and other things makes the game seem like I should be playing Harry Potter instead of The Book of Unwritten Tales 2.

Overall, it's still a fun and imaginative game, albeit with reduced original ideas.

PROS
1. Game is fun
I love the puzzles and surprises. E.g. Ivo is pregnant?

2. Extended Game
It's much longer than the first. You have to solve multiple puzzles in one map.

3. Tougher Puzzles
Much more difficult to solve this time compared to The Book of Unwritten Tales 1

CONS
1. Too much copying
Just too much with the Harry Potter stuff.

2. Double checking on locations
I don't like having to search twice on the same object without the icon changing to a spanner. It forces players to click twice on everything.

3. Inventory
I preferred scrolling down to look at your inventory items rather than opening an inventory bag. The inventory bag tended to block the object you were trying to interact with.

NEUTRAL
1. Missable Achievements
I am not against hard to do achievements, but I am against starting the game all over again just to get certain achievements. E.g. Finding Igor's room in the dark, hitting all the poses in Drunken Punch, etc

22876661.review:
The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 – продолжения серии пародийных, юмористических квестов от немецкой студии King Art. В свое время первая часть оставила неизгладимое впечатление и продолжения игры очень ждал. Помимо замечательных персонажей, красивой рисовки и другого бла-бла-бла данная серия высмеивает все квестовые и не только штампы. На каждом шагу отсылки к другим играм/фильмам/сериалам. Даже концовка здесь тоже, вроде-как и «хэппи-энд», а вроде и не совсем. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=633852933
С другой стороны, назвать эту игру полноценным квестом рука тоже не поднимается. Ну то есть тут все вроде как по канонам жанра, но самый главный элемент – головоломки уходят на второй план. По большей части вы будете исследовать мир и общаться с другими персонажами, а упор делается на сюжет и развитие главных героев игры. Также игра заботливо (по нажатию на «пробел») покажет все активные точки на экране, и механика Point&Click квеста херится ко всем чертям. Кому-то такой подход нравится, кому-то нет. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=677760668
Серия The Book of Unwritten Tales один из немногих квестов последнего времени, который выполнен в 3D графике. И нужно признать отличной! Игры от других ведущих разработчиков жанра, будь то Pendulo, Daedalic или Revolution выполнены в двух измерениях с красивой рисовкой и, наверное, такой подход правильнее, учитывая общую немассовость жанра. Также в игре не подкачала и музыка.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=681073373
В итоге получилась отличная игра с юмором, с долей иронии, со смыслом. Не без минусов. Головоломки в игре довольно простые, но зато почти все логичные. Но ради отличной истории и юмора, игру уже можно рекомендовать к прохождению.

22747921.review:
Hormis quelques soucis de traduction et de très rares bugs (bloquants, hélas, qui obligent donc à recommencer certains passages), difficile de reprocher quoi que ce soit à ce deuxième opus des [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/215160][b][i]Book of Unwritten Tales[/i][/b][/url]. Une légère propension au capilotractage, à la rigueur, avec des interactions parfois quelque peu... extravagantes.

Pour le reste, il surpasse en tous points son prédécesseur : de l'excellente bande son à l'humour omniprésent, en passant par une foule de références à la culture geek, des graphismes de loin plus agréables - même si vous n'irez pas jusqu'à vous extasier - à la durée de vie, remarquable pour le genre. L'histoire s'étale en effet sur plus d'une vingtaine d'heures, sans qu'on ne s'ennuie jamais !

Sans compter que les développeurs ont eu à coeur de minimiser la frustration du joueur, détail qui me fait l'apprécier d'autant plus. Par exemple, la résolution de certaines énigmes nécéssite beaucoup d'allers et retours, comme dans la majorité des point'n'click. Or, là où d'autres nous auraient infligé de traverser quantité de tableaux, et à de multiples reprises, ici chaque déplacement est instantané.

Bref, [b][i]The Book of Unwritten Tales 2[/i][/b] est une valeur sûre qui plaira sans aucun doute aux amateurs du genre.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre ![/h1]

22657870.review: This is a very entertaining story with a good sense of humour that pokes fun at the traditional rpg. Assuming you play legitimately without a walkthrough, the game should last you a long time figuring things out by comparasin to other click adventures, and you'll easily obtain any achievements you missed along the way by loading your previous saves (completionists tip: don't skip the credits at the end, the achievement for watching the credits doesn't count when watching from the menu). The puzzles present a good bit of challenge and you'll end up wracking your brain at times. luckily the hardest ones are optional, but those ones are worth it to pick up the extra outfits. However, it is very pricy for what it is and the extra price for the almanac edition doesn't really warrant getting that upgrade either. Overall I'd say it'd be good to get when it goes on sale, or if you're just swimming in money and don't care.

Nachdem ich nun The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 zu 100% abgeschlossen habe, möchte eine kurze Zusammenfassung abgeben.

Mir hat das Spiel im ganzen sehr gut gefallen und ist etwas besser wie schon der gute erste Teil des Spiels.
Es lebt von seinem Humor, den aberwitzigen Figuren und deren grandioser Vertonung.

Ab und an kommt es mal vor das sich die Rätsel etwas ziehen und nicht sofort logisch sind. Dies ist aber nur ein kleiner negativer Aspekt, dieses ansonten doch sehr gelungenen Titels.

Wer mal wieder ein gutes Point & Click Spiel sucht wird hier fündig.

22030529.review:
The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 to druga część docenionej przez graczy, humorystycznej przygodówki point'n'click. W grze powracamy do krainy Aventásii, aby ponownie wcielić się z znaną z pierwszej odsłony czwórkę bohaterów, gnoma Wilbura, elfią księżniczkę Ivo, łowcę przygód Nate'a i zaprzyjaźnionego z nim stworka Zwierzaka. Od pokonania arcywiedźmy Mortragi minęło kilka lat, a wojna pomiędzy Armią Cieni i Sojuszem została zakończona. Jednak zło nigdy nie śpi i niedługo nad Aventásią znowu zapadnie ciemność. A może tym razem będzie to zmieniająca potwory i zamki w pluszaki i domki dla lalek różowość?

Już po uruchomieniu gry widać, że na jej produkcję przeznaczono o wiele większy niż w przypadku pierwszej części budżet. Wita nas kolorowa i bardzo ładna grafika. Modele postaci są bardziej szczegółowe i lepiej wyanimowane niż w oryginale. Poprawiono nawet projekty lokacji, które już w jedynce wyglądały świetnie. Gra oferuje też znacznie dłuższą rozgrywkę. Sam główny wątek to zabawa na dwadzieścia godzin, a dodatkowo, dzięki hojności graczy, udało się zebrać fundusze na stworzenie kilku zadań pobocznych, za których wykonywanie otrzymujemy alternatywne stroje dla bohaterów. Warto też wspomnieć, że w przeciwieństwie do pierwowzoru, The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 w wersji na platformę Steam otrzymało polskie napisy.

Najmocniejszą stroną omawianej produkcji jest zdecydowanie przedstawiona w grze opowieść oraz, w szczególności wszechobecne w niej humor i easter eggi. Uruchamiając The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 należy się przygotować na to, że na naszej twarzy co chwile gościć będzie szeroki uśmiech, wywołany zabawnymi kwestiami, przerysowanymi postaciami lub żartami sytuacyjnymi. Na każdym kroku napotykać też będziemy, również zabawne, nawiązania do innych gier, książek oraz filmów o tematyce fantasy i panujących w nich stereotypach. Pomijając warstwę humorystyczną, mamy tu do czynienia z wielowątkową, różnorodną, dobrze napisaną i ciekawą, baśniową opowieścią. Jest ona troszkę dojrzalsza niż ta z pierwszej części. Większy nacisk położono na relacje między bohaterami, w szczególności między Ivo i Nate'em, a niektóre żarty są raczej skierowane do starszego widza. Warto zaznaczyć, że aby w pełni czerpać przyjemność z The Book of Unwritten Tales 2, trzeba znać pierwszą odsłonę cyklu, bo jest tu do niej dużo nawiązań. Pod względem rozgrywki mamy do czynienia z typową przygodówką point'n'click, w której za pomocą myszy dokonujemy interakcji z innymi postaciami i przedmiotami, urozmaiconą różnymi minigrami. Przez większość czasu sterujemy jednym z bohaterów, ale czasem możemy przełączać się pomiędzy dwójką lub nawet trójką z nich. Zagadki, które będziemy musieli rozwiązać, są naprawdę dobrze zaprojektowane. Wymagają czasem chwili zastanowienia, aczkolwiek ich rozwiązania są logiczne i sensowne, choć nie raz, w zabawny sposób, absurdalne.

The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 przewyższa swojego poprzednika pod wieloma względami, aczkolwiek nie pod wszystkimi. Pierwsza część serii co chwilę czymś mnie zaskakiwała. Na każdym kroku napotykałem nowe lokacje i nowe postacie. I czerpałem z tego nie lada przyjemność, bo każda z nich była świetnie zaprojektowana i miała swój niepowtarzalny styl. Grając w The Book of Unwritten Tales 2, nie czułem tego samego, wiele występujących ty bohaterów i poziomów znałem już z pierwszej części. Nie twierdzę, że gra jest nudna i wtórna. Nowych lokacji i postaci tu nie brakuje, a potencjał drzemiący w tych starych został wykorzystany bardzo dobrze. Po prostu nie zaskakiwała mnie tak często jak jej poprzedniczka. Zakończenie gry natomiast spowodowało u mnie uczucie sporego niedosytu. Kończy się ona typowym cliffhangerem i zostawia wiele ważnych kwestii niewyjaśnionych. Trzeba jeszcze wspomnieć o jednej rzeczy, której nie było w pierwszym The Book of Unwritten Tales, a która znalazła się w drugim. Mianowicie o bugach, których trochę napotkałem. Podczas gry zdarzało się przykładowo, że jeden z bohaterów nie potrafił dojść do wskazanego przez mnie miejsca i zamiast tego ciągle chodził w kółko. Innym razem musiałem zrestartować grę, bo jedna z postaci zawiesiła się podczas dialogu. Poza tym część dialogów jest nagrana zdecydowanie ciszej niż reszta i zdarza się, że któryś z bohaterów w środku wypowiedzi staje się prawie niesłyszalny. Takie sytuacje zdarzają się w sumei rzadko. Ale jak to się już stanie, to nie da się ich nie zauważyć.

Podsumowując, The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 to gra większa, ładniejsza, a co najważniejsze tak samo zabawna jak jej pierwowzór. Oferuje interesującą baśniową opowieść, przyjemną rozgrywkę i ogromną dawkę dobrego humoru. Czy jest to tytuł lepsza od pierwowzoru? Ciężko mi to ocenić. Z czystym sumieniem mogę jednak powiedzieć, że przy obu tych produkcjach bawiłem się znakomicie i są to jedne z najlepszych przygodówek, w jakie przyszło mi grać. The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 polecam każdemu, nawet tym graczom, którzy w przygodówkach na co dzień nie gustują.

Eines der geilsten Adventure-Games die es gibt. Ich war vom Ersten Teil schon überweltigt ... viel Witz, lustige Naspielungan auf alles Mögliche und urkomische Dialoge machen dieses Spiel zu einem Erlebnis. The good stuff:
Great art style
Great humor with lots of jabs at fantasy tropes
Great characters

Things that could be improved:
A little too much environment reuse and backtracking
The final showdown is extremely short and a bit anticlimactic and looks like it had most of its content cut (it looks like a whole section with Ivo and Critter was cut out at the end)

Things that should not have been:
This game is quite buggy and has more audio glitches than anything else I've played. You pretty much have to play with subtitles or you'll miss a LOT of the dialogue.

Conclusion:
Definitely worth playing if you're at all into adventure games (or even funny games in general). Looking forwards to a sequel (the way it ended pretty much means they have to do one).

21137354.review:
Pretty much everything about this game is superb: the characters (most of which are from TBOUT), the dialogues and voice overs, the visuals and locations, the puzzles and how they are tied in with the story.

I especially liked how in mere 15 minutes the game manages to pay tribute to the old adventure games, Back to the Future, and The Big Bang Theory (directly quoting Sheldon Cooper in the last case). And it doesn't stop at that, being funny and inventive for the whole 20+ hours. 

Alas, for such a long game the ending feels rushed and leaves a lot of questions unanswered. Obviously, King Art has plans for TBOUT 3, but that's still not an excuse for a cliffhanger plus a lot of plot holes.

Anyway, this is still one of the best contemporary adventure games along with Deponia trilogy and Sherlock Holmes series. A must buy for any fan of point-and-click adventures. The best thing is, you can play with your kids. Yes, they won't probably understand all the puns and references, but it's still a great family game.

9/10

21011680.review:
Erneut ein Meisterwerk des Adventure-Genres !

Hier stimmt einfach Alles. 
Die Grafik ist liebevoll gezeichnet, absolut stimmig zur Geschichte, mit viel Augenmerk auf Details.

Die Soundkulisse drängt sich nicht mit Effekten in den Vordergrund, sondern bildet halt eine Basis, auf der sich die anderen Stilelemente wie Dialoge und Musik glanzvoll entfalten. 

Apropos Musik: Die war mir meist zulaut, besonders im Menü, aber das lässt sich in den Optionen ändern. 
Das musikalische Hauptthema aus BouT ist auch im 2. Teil wieder zuhören. ( Ich liebe es ja, hat so was von Indiana Jones )

Die Sprecher sind wie im 1. Teil ausgesucht und echte Künstler. ( Ich kenne allerdings nur die deutsche Sprachversion )
Gerade diese Sprecher lassen die Figuren wirklich leben, erst so kann sich der Spieler emotional an diese binden. Genial waren auch die Dialoge. Nicht nur, dass in bestem Deutsch formuliert wurde, was man heutzutage ja nicht mehr oft genießen darf; Empfehlung zur Sprachbildung auch für junge Menschen an dieser Stelle. 
Der hintersinnige und auchmal vordergründige Witz hat in diesem 2ten Teil noch an Qualität gewonnen. Köstlich !!!

Sehr gefiel mir, dass manche Rätsel über mehrere Charaktere oder Orte verteilt sind, sodass man schon um die Ecke denken muss, um zur Lösung zugelangen. ( Für das Nimspiel war ich aber zu blöd, da musste ich Hilfe in Anspruch nehmen. 
Und da haben die Entwickler bewiesen, dass Ihnen der Spielspaß wichtiger war, als nur die Präsentation eines Rätsels. Sie geben dem Spieler ein Ausweichmöglichkeit an die Hand, ein Fortkommen auch dann zu ermöglichen, wenn man das Nim(m)-Spiel nie für sich entscheiden kann. )

Ich habe recht lang an diesem Adventure gespielt, da ich versucht habe, auch jeden Dialog zu hören, und Alles zu entdecken. Leider konnte ich einige Achievements nicht erringen, da die Story eine unerwartete Wendung nahm.

Das Spiel endet mit einem Cliffhanger, wir dürfen also auf einen weiteren Teil gespannt sein.

Jeder Adventure-Fan wird das Spiel kennen, und auch wahrscheinlich schon gezockt haben. Für alle Anderen spreche ich eine absolute Empfehlung aus, auch für die, die mal in die Adventure-Ecke hineinschnuppern wollen.

Bedienung mit der Maus ist der beste Weg, das Spiel zusteuern. Das Keyboard braucht man nur sehr selten, ein Gamepad wird unterstützt, aber ich mochte das Rumzicken der Figuren nicht. Allerdings lässt sich das Spiel hervorragend mit dem Steam Controller bedienen, besser als mit einem X360.

Sorry für dieses lange Review, aber ich meine, dieses Spiel hat Ausführlichkeit verdient. 

Ich war begeistert, und es wird mir als eine gute Spielerfahrung in Erinnerung bleiben.

Nachtrag: Engine ist die Unity3D, und dürfte auch auf schwächeren Rechnern laufen.
Das Spiel ist perfekt für Stereo3D geeignet. Top !

20707767.review: Seguito perfettamente riuscito per questa avventura punta&clicca sulle vicende dell'aspirante mago Wilbur, il pirata Nate (e Critter naturalmente), la principessa elfica Ivo e il malvagio Munkus. Come i capitoli precedenti il gioco fa satira sui comuni stereotipi del genere fantasy e dei gdr con citazioni dalle serie più famose, dal Trono di Spade al Signore degli Anelli al Dottor House (è sempre Lupus!). Seguirete la storia da varie angolazioni vestendo i panni di più protagonisti e per risolvere determinati puzzles dovrete a volte fare "gioco di squadra" e controllarli tutti contemporaneamente, scambiando gli oggetti dell'inventario dall'uno all'altro. Consiglio di giocare la saga per intero per godersi pienamente la storia.

20636297.review: What a fantastic adventure game. I can not honestly think of the last time I played an adventure game this well crafted. More than just a homage to old adventure games of the 90s/early 2000s, Book of Unwritten Tales 2 reminds players what an adventure game truly feels like. I wholeheartedly recommend this game.

20635380.review:
Original Book of Unwritten tales was a complete surprise - it was released at the time when it seemed that comedic adventure games were truly gone there was that game, looking good, voice acted good, with a restrained amount of pop references and very strong self identity and pretty good gameplay. Critter Chronicles, while not as good and clearly started as more of a short expansion made bigger for a full standalone release with pointless filler, was still a great game and I've had a lot of fun with it. The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 manages to be both much better and kinda worse than the first two at the same time.

It still looks fantastic - even better now, voice acting is still great and a lot of humour and dialogue is still good. The sense of adventure is here, for the most part, and gameplay-wise around 70% of the game are very nicely done. However, closer to the middle the amount of "and now you have to do this" piling up on top of previously solved puzzles/issues in the absolutely same almost unchaged location in each of 5 Chapters started to get annoying. Chapter 3 introduced a lot of pointless back and forth and Chapter 4 was all about that - running around completely different locations, finding items in one place to solve puzzles in other places. And it was just a bit... too much. I'll give KING art they're due - they did try to make every new task more or less fresh and events rarely stalled for too long. But moments of "can we move on now?" happened more often than I would've liked and ending parts of the game were quite dissapointing.

And the weakest part of this, by the end, was the storytelling. The game started very strong, but starting from the middle it just went "whatever", despite introducing actually cool characters or moments from time to time. And ended in a very disappointing sequel setup, which made the entire game feel less of a TBoUT 2 and more like TBoUT 2. Part 1, where both previous games felt self-contained stories that can live without sequels. And pop culture humor is crossing the limits way more this time around. In the first games there were actual attempts at world building. Here the identity gets easily lost among all the "this is this game, this is this movie, this is this book" things that happen all the time - the entire closing chapter is one huge Halloween-themed reference party. And it doesn't help that despite having 3 characters again it rarely feels like a proper 3-character story, like the first game did.

But I'm disappointed just because how much better many things were, just how much potential there was and still is and just how much I actually liked playing most of the game. Not all. Constructor "puzzle" needs to die in a fire. Ahem. But yeah - it's still a good game, just... better served for those who already invested themselves in the series with the first game, but not as good of a sequel or a standalone game as it clearly had every chance to be.

20619037.review: Just like the 1st TBOUT game, I thouroughly enjoyed the sequel. It was way longer, and the characters were developed even more. It ends on a cliffhanger ending though, so watch out! For those of you who like challenging puzzle games, this is the game for you! I found myself wanting to use a walkthrough all the time, but tried not to unless a particular puzzle took more than an hour. I felt like the story itself was really good up until the end, where it seemed rushed, and left us with an incomplete story. I do hope they come out with a sequel soon! I love the voice actors, they do a great job. However, I feel like some characters got way more play time than others. In conclusion, I highly recommend this game due to its great story, challengin puzzles, and amazing artwork.

20307692.review:
W The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 grało mi się całkiem przyjemnie, jednak było kilka elementów, które nie do końca mi się spodobały.

Przede wszystkim wątek główny zaczyna zarysowywać się dopiero po około 10 godzinach grania. Wcześniej towarzyszymy bohaterom w ich życiowych perypetiach, ale brakuje jakiegoś konkretnego celu, który pozwoliłby mocniej zaangażować się w fabułę. Przyznam, że w połowie drugiego epizodu byłem już tym porządnie zirytowany i kto wie, czy nie dostałbym apopleksji, gdyby nie nagłe pojawienie się pewnej mało sympatycznej, ale jakże miło przyjętej przeze mnie postaci :P
Na szczęście od tej chwili było już znacznie lepiej. Nie mogę wprawdzie powiedzieć, by opowiadana historia w pełni mnie pochłonęła, ale byłem ciekaw, jak potoczą się dalsze losy bohaterów. Zakończenie jakoś szczególnie mnie nie rozczarowało, ale też nie jestem nim zachwycony. Byłoby lepiej, gdyby autorzy zdecydowali się wyjaśnić poszczególne wątki, tymczasem postanowili zrobić nagłe cięcie w najmniej spodziewanym momencie. Tym samym zobligowali się do stworzenia kolejnej części Księgi i jeśli tego nie zrobią, narażą się na mój srogi gniew.

Nie jestem także w stu procentach przekonany do jakości obecnego w grze humoru. Wprawdzie było sporo momentów, w których się uśmiechnąłem (na specjalne wyróżnienie zasługuje genialny fragment w bibliotece), ale niektóre żarty nie zrobiły na mnie żadnego wrażenia. Na plus mogę z pewnością zaliczyć powrót kilku postaci znanych z jedynki oraz parę autentycznie zabawnych nawiązań (na przykład do Z archiwum X). 

Chciałbym w tym miejscu skończyć z narzekaniem, ale że straszna ze mnie maruda, to przyczepię się jeszcze do zagadek - o ile te ekwipunkowe stoją na solidnym poziomie, tak pozostałe są niestety niedopracowane. Z jedną z nich nie sposób sobie poradzić bez wyłączenia muzyki, w innej brakuje tekstów, zaś w kolejnej można doprowadzić do sytuacji bez wyjścia (jedynym ratunkiem jest wczytanie wcześniejszego zapisu).

Na tym oficjalnie kończę listę żali. Zaznaczam, że generalnie fabuła, humor i zagadki nie są w The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 złe. Po prostu oczekiwałem czegoś więcej, dlatego jestem nieco rozczarowany.
Słowa pochwały należą się autorom za bardzo ładną grafikę, dobry dubbing i niezłą muzykę. No i fajnie, że wciąż powstają przygodówki, których ukończenie może zająć nawet około 30 godzin.

7+/10

19865305.review:
A charming, hilarious and fun adventure with the perfect balance of puzzle difficulty. This point and click has my favourite puzzle design because they are not too hard to figure out, but also not too easy. The characters are unique, interesting and lively, and the graphics are gorgeous without putting too much strain on a computer (as a laptop gamer, I especially appreciate this as there is nothing sadder to me than a game I really want to play with specs that my computer can just about manage with lags). As in the first game, Wilbur is an absolute treasure, Ivo is as great a female character as ever and Critter is quirky, sweet and loyal. Nate has grown more likable in this game as well as gained a fair amount of depth and development. 

Personally I enjoyed the return of NPCs from the previous title as I like callbacks and appearences from earlier games in a series, and they are just as fun to talk to and interact with as they were in the first game. The voice acting is absolutely brilliant with a range of accents and voices which are organic and smooth. 

I also have fun with the function of switching between characters and swapping items between them, as well as the little conversations they share. I love the addition of sidequests in which you can gain costumes which look great on the characters, and so feel like a nice reward. The ost is also extremely good with a few pieces sticking with me after I take a break from the game.

The expansion on and creation of areas such as the Elfburrow is also interesting to see, giving a nice variation on areas and allowing more characters or interactions to be introduced and viewed. The length of the game is a healthy one and helps make it worth every penny, especially when it's on sale.

I had to look up for help a few times, but I still think that the difficulty is perfectly balanced, allowing me to feel accomplished as I beat most of the game myself. The game has also bugged out a couple of times, but not to an extent where it's too frustrating. The autosave feature makes it possible to not have to go back as far as you would think. The game engine used for this sequel seems to be a little more buggy than the previous games, but as I said it's nothing too bad. I have researched others' experiences with the game and a lot of the issues seem to be fixed. Sometimes the voices do not play, or have a strange quiet echo to them, but most of the time you can just have the character repeat the line and hear it properly.

I've heard complaints about the ending, but honestly I see no problems with it. It does what it's supposed to - set up for the next game in the series. In the sequel I'd really like to see more of Lizzy.

All in all this game has imprinted on me and is a real joy to experience, making me want to play as much as I can at once and return to it often.

One of the best adventure games I played. It is like reading an interactive novel aka Harry Potter/Lord of the Rings.
Played the original 'The Book of Unwritten Tales' - overall presentation level is keeping up and do not disappoint like some other boring pixel hunting click adventure games.
-Beautiful and engaging story
- Remarkable and charismatic characters, like in a novel book
- Lots of humour and pop culture references (more in this game comparing to the first one!)

- Solving puzzles is done very creatively, so you would feel ashamed if you read or watch though the walkthrough. You actually motivated to merge onto this fantasy world, trying to understand its rules and logic.

19684870.review:
The best Book of Unwritten Tales game to date, with regards to the story, the jokes and the puzzles as well. I had points were I had to pause for a loud laugh, and the puzzles were mostly solvable.

The setting is a parody of fantasy RPGs and MMORPGs, and the fourth wall is not only kicked out but exploded and its place was sowed with salt; basically, the entire game is a giant homage to these kinds of stories and games. The story is itself generic, but told with great style; similar to other point-and-click adventures the style is the important aspect...

I had two issues with the game:
1. There were some sections that felt padded out. Maybe a bit less would have been more.
2. I had some strange graphical glitches; after an hour or two of play, first the colors and then everything was rendered incorrectly. At such points, the only way to go was to save my progress and restart the game (luckily, saving always worked, so I have not lost progress because of this issues).

19552632.review:
Few sequels live up to the original, but this one comes pretty close. Just like the first Book of Unwritten Tales, the sequel is full of fun, funny puzzles, full of tons of pop culture references (D&D, World of Warcraft, Lord of the Rings, Doctor Who, and the obligatory "Guybrush Threepwood: Mighty Pirate" dialogue option, just to name a few). Unlike a lot of fantasy adventure games, which try to make you invested in them because of epic storylines while having brain-breakingly evil puzzles, these puzzles are fun but still challenging, taking some ingenuity but not a lot of trips to a walkthrough. There are your traditional "combine every item in your inventory to every other item in your invetory" puzzzles, but there are a lot more interesting onces, too, involving math, dance, and the optional gambling dice game. Add to that the same great characters you met in the first installment, some great new ones, some unexpected plot twists, hilarious dialogue, and even some genuine heart and emotion, and you've got one amazing episode in an already amazing franchise.

10/10. Would adventure again.

19193450.review:
필자는 포인트앤클릭 장르는 이 게임이 처음이다
퍼즐을 선호하는 유저들 중에서도 취향을 많이 가를 듯하다
기본적으로 퍼즐 게임이 여타 장르와 차별화되는 특성으로
정적인 플레이, 퍼즐을 푼 뒤의 성취감 등이 있지만,
BoUT2는 굵직한 스토리까지 받쳐준, 포인트앤클릭 장르로의
내 첫 진입을 두 팔 벌려 환영해준 게임이다

1> 구성
판타지 장르를 기반으로 한 터라 퍼즐의 구성은 조금 난해하다.
아이템을 얻은 뒤 아이템끼리의 조합, 배경 사물이나 다른 캐릭터와의 
상호작용으로 퍼즐을 풀어나가는 형식이다. 
흔히 포탈류의 게임, 즉 하나의 퍼즐이 하나의 스테이지를 
수반하는 식의 레벨 클리어 같은 성취감은 다소 떨어진다.
그러나 플레이하면서 중간 중간 나오는 유머나 패러디는 피식 웃을 만하다.
캐릭터 특성에 따라 성우 연기도 좋고, 캐주얼한 컨셉도 필자는 마음에 들었다.
Space 키를 누르면 상호작용할 수 있는 힌트를 제공해주는 부분도 큰 도움이다.
다만 이것들이 화면 밖에 위치한 경우도 있고, 우측 하단의 UI가 거슬리기도 한다.

2> 그래픽 / 사운드
고사양을 요구하지 않는 그래픽은 수준에 맞게 캐주얼한 컨셉으로 게임을
잘 풀어놓았다. 각 마을, 레벨의 디자인은 꽤 섬세하며, 사운드도 이를 잘 
커버하는 편. 

3> 스토리
게임을 처음 시작하면 1의 엔딩이 어땠을지 대강 느낌이 온다.(속편 암시)
이번 편 역시 스토리를 마무리짔지 않고 넘겨버린 듯하다.
어쩌면 매니아층을 만들어내 지속적인 시리즈물로 연명하기 위함일 수도?
퍼즐이 스토리에 잘 녹여내어 플레이어를 집중하게 만들기는 하지만
앞에서 말한 듯이 판타지 세계관이라 억지스러운 부분도 다소 있다.
게다가 스토리 흐름 때문인지, 지나치게 선형적인 면도 있다.
1,2,3의 단서가 있으면 다짜고짜 2,3,1 3,1,2 처럼 단서를 모아 조합하는 게
아니라 정말 1,2,3 순서로 풀어야만 하는 식.

4> 기타
이따금 버그가 있었다. 프리징인 듯 프리징 아닌 프리징 같은 버그였는데,
캐릭터가 박혀서 못나온다거나, 사운드 시스템 버그로 캐릭터들이 말을
하지 않는 버그였다.
중간중간에 저장을 해두자. 자동저장만 믿다가는 골로 갈 수도 있다.

5> 총평
어쩌다보니 단점만 써내버렸다.
그러나 필자는 이 게임을 산 걸 후회하지 않는다.
공식 한글화 게임이니까. 그리고 세일 기간을 감안해 구입했기 때문에
돈 값은 충분히 한 셈이다. 
아기자기한 컨셉과 정적 퍼즐은 내가 좋아하는 완벽한 조합이었고,
BoUT2는 그 기대에 적절히 보답해 주었다.
후에 3가 필히 나오리라 생각하기 때문에, 그 전에 1이 세일에 들어가면
1도 구입해서 해 볼 생각이다.

7.3 / 10

18982119.review:
After approximately 30 hours of mostly very good gameplay, I've finally finished the BoUT2. 

Almost everything about the game is excellent. The graphics are wonderful and the animation and sound is good. The story is interesting and the jokes are amusing, some are even laugh out loud funny, which is very rare.

Voice acting is good to excellent, with maybe a couple of minor characters not being very good.

The only negative are the puzzles. The vast majority of the puzzles are fairly simple and fair. Unfotunately there are a handful of more difficult puzzles that are very frustrating. Some of them are frustrating because of errors in where objects are labeled and where you actually have to click to interact with the object. In one screen where your movement is very restricted your character blocks a key item you have to interact with so I missed the object until I had to resort to using a walkthrough.

Despite this, overall I highly recommend the game. It's one of the best adventure games of the last few years. I hope another sequel is produced.

18536666.review:
[h1] Review The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 [/h1]

The Book of Unwritten Tales (BoUT2) ist ein ganz klassisches Adventure - nicht mehr und auch nicht weniger darf und kann man erwarten. Das Spiel setzt - im Gegensatz zu einem Großteil der anderen Andventures nicht auf gezeichnete Hintergründe, sondern auf 3D-Grafik. Diese sieht sehr stimmungsvoll aus. Ich persönlich finde bei Adventures schöne gezeichente Hintergründe allerdings besser und passender, aber das ist natürlich Geschmacksache.

King Art hat hier auf jeden Fall wieder ein gutes Adventure geliefert, welches storytechnisch auf den ersten Teil aufbaut. Da es einige Anspielungen auf den Vorgänger und das Prequel gibt (The Book of Unwritten Tales: Die Vieh Chroniken), ist es sinnvoll diese beiden Spiele vorab zu spielen. Zwingend erforderlich ist es für die Story allerdings nicht. Dennoch empfehle ich es, da ich die beiden anderen Spiele aus der Reihe etwas besser fand (speziell Teil 1). 

Was am letzten Teil der Serie (die Vieh Chroniken) noch zu bemängeln war, waren die wenigen Schauplätze und die etwas kurze Spielzeit (ich weiß es nicht mehr genau, aber ich dürfte maximal zehn Stunden gespielt haben - und ich bin ein langsamer Spieler). Beides hat sich geändert, es gibt in BoUT2 sehr viele Schauplätze und die Spielzeit hat sich immens gesteigert. Ich habe über 30 Stunden benötigt (wie gesagt, ich bin ein langsamer Spieler). Allerdings hätte das Spiel meiner Auffassung nach gerne etwas komprimierter sein dürfen, den die Story plätscherte teilweise ein wenig vor sich hin - da hat mir Teil 1 deutlich besser gefallen (welches auch länger war als die Vieh Chroniken).

Aber das ist meckern auf einem recht hohen Niveau, denn wer (humorvolle) Adventures mag, dem kann ich BoUT2 uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Die Gags sind größtenteils gut und ziehen serientypisch das ganze Fantasy-Genre durch den Kakao (also alles, was man so kennt, seien es Filme, Spiele oder Bücher). World of Warcraft bekommt nun deutlich weniger sein Fett weg wie noch zu Zeiten des ersten Teils (aber 2009 war WoW auch im Zenith der Aufmerksamkeit), ist aber nach wie vor mit einigen Seitenhieben vertreten (oder eben inzwischen allgemein das MMO-Genre, wie man es sehen will). Auf jeden Fall wird der Gelegenheitsspieler wohl deutlich weniger Gags entdecken (bzw. verstehen), als der geneigte "Vielspieler". :)

Zu erwähnen wäre noch, dass das Spiel über ein paar (wenige) Nebenquets verfügt. Die sind teilweise etwas versteckt, aber definitiv lohneswert. Speziell eine - und ohne zu viel verraten zu wollen: bei einer Reise in die Vergangenheit, reist die eigene Computertechnik gleich mit - in die "Steinzeit" der Home Computer. Absolut lohnenwert und spaßig, diese Quest sollte man nicht verpassen. ;)

Technisch macht BoUT2 insgesamt einen guten Eindruck. Die Grafik ist ok (wie eingangs gesagt bin ich bei Adventures nicht der große 3D-Freund), der Sound ebenfalls und die Sprecher sind gut gewählt. Allerdings hatte ich (speziell beim Charakter Wilbur) ab und an mal das Problem, dass die Sprachausgabe falsch abgemischt wurde (also sehr leise war), oder völlig aussetzte. Da halfen dann nur Untertitel - schade, dass das ein halbes Jahr nach Release noch nicht behoben wurde. Darüber hinaus hatte ich keine technischen Probleme und kann mit maximalen Details in 1080p spielen (Core i7-2600k @ 4,5 GHz, 12 GB RAM, Geforce GTX 970 SLI - da dürfte aber auch deutlich weniger reichen).

[b] Meine Wertung: [/b]
Grafik: 7/10
Sound: 8/10
Umfang: 10/10
Atmosphäre: 8/10

[b] Spielspaß: 82% [/b]
